intro: Leuconotis subavenis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
